prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to implement serverless handlers using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Serverless Handlers using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide will walk you through implementing serverless functions using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI supports asynchronous and synchronous requests out of the box
FastAPI provides automatic documentation generation based on your code
Integration with popular databases (PostgreSQL, SQLAlchemy, etc.) and cloud providers (AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions)

code_examples.notes: This code snippet demonstrates a simple FastAPI application.

code_examples.code:
import uvicorn
uvicorn.run('main:app', host='0.0.0.0', port=8000, log_level='info')
code_examples.notes: This command runs the FastAPI application using Uvicorn ASGI server.

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for optimal performance and support.
FastAPI version 0.75.0 or later is recommended to leverage the latest features.
Uvicorn version 0.19.0 or later should be used for deploying serverless applications.
caveats: Ensure that your Python environment has all required dependencies installed.
When deploying to cloud providers, configure appropriate triggers and settings for your serverless functions.
